title.narrative: Denmark’s core contribution to the World Organisation Against Torture (OMCT) 2021-2022

description.narrative: The Danish grant is a core contribution OMCT in 2021-2022 in support of the activities and programmatic goals of the organisation as outlined in the OMCT’s Strategic Plan 2021-2024 (Strategy 2024). The project covers all five complementary priorities of the OMCT Strategy 2024, implemented with the SOS-Torture Network and other anti-torture actors and initiatives: 1) Public engagement: winning back global resolve on the absolute prohibition, 2) Accountability: winning justice for victims, and pushing back on impunity, 3) Pushing for reforms and universal systems; 4) Protection of those in situations of vulnerability, and 5) Protection of Human Rights Defenders and the right to defend. The project focuses on human rights and torture prevention. The key objective is to advance toward the eradication of torture worldwide, by strengthening the growth, sustainability, cooperation, and impact of the global civil society anti-torture movement.
